title: Building and accessing an REL database
proctitle: CHI '81: Proceedings of the Joint Conference on Easier and More Productive Use of Computer Systems. (Part - II): Human Interface and the User Interface - Volume 1981
abstract: This paper discusses the construction of an experimental database at Hewlett-Packard Laboratories using the REL ENGLISH software provided by Frederick and Bozena Thompson of the California Institute of Technology. Of special interest is the quasi-natural interface and its ability to tolerate ambiguities. This provides a support mechanism for multiple user views of the same data in which disambiguation is accomplished during semantic processing.

references.text: Loebner E.E. and Gadol S.D. Living Taxonomies in the Corporate World: The Need For Multinested Data Models, a paper presented at the 1981 Joint Conference on Easier and More Productive Use of Computing Systems
Thompson F. B. and Thompson B. H. Practical Natural Language Processing: The REL System as a Prototype, Advances in Computers 13, (1975), 109-168
Thompson B. H. REL User's Reference Guide (1977), California Institute of Technology

Egly D.G. and Wescourt K.T. Cognitive Style, Categorization, and Vocational Effects on Performance of REL Database Users, a paper presented at the 1981 Joint Conference on Easier and More Productive Use of Computing Systems

Egly D.G. and Loebner E.E. Evidence for Natural Language Use to Decipher REL ENGLISH Database Access, a paper presented at the 1981 Joint Conference on Easier and More Productive Use of Computing Systems
Clark H.H. and Clark E.V. Psychology and Language: An Introduction to Psycholinguistics (1977), Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, New York
